data.title: Compugen's earnings report on 3/2 expected EPS $0.10. Strong historical performance saw 2.99% stock increase last quarter. Trading at $1.79, shares up 1.38% over last 52 weeks. Investors eagerly await report.
data.description: Biotech company Compugen (NASDAQ: CGEN) is scheduled to release its quarterly earnings results on Monday, March 2, 2026. Analysts are anticipating an earnings per share (EPS) of $0.10. Investors are eagerly awaiting the announcement, hoping for results that exceed expectations and positive guidance for the upcoming quarter. It is important to highlight that guidance provided can heavily impact stock price movements, especially for new investors. Compugen outperformed expectations by $0.02 in the last quarter, resulting in a 2.99% increase in share price the following day. Here's a breakdown of Compugen's recent earnings performances and the subsequent stock price changes: Q3 2025: Estimated EPS -0.09, Actual EPS -0.07, Price Change 2.99%; Q2 2025: Estimated EPS -0.08, Actual EPS -0.08, Price Change -1.37%; Q1 2025: Estimated EPS -0.05, Actual EPS -0.08, Price Change 1.44%; Q4 2024: Estimated EPS 0.07, Actual EPS -0.07, Price Change 7.74%. As of February 26, Compugen shares were trading at $1.79, marking a 1.38% increase over the past 52 weeks. Investors can access the full story on Benzinga.com for more insights.

data.title: Kaltra introduces new technology to boost microchannel evaporator performance in cooling systems, making it more efficient.
data.description: In ALTMUNSTER, Austria on February 27, 2026, Kaltra revealed a groundbreaking refrigerant distribution technology that enhances the efficiency of microchannel evaporators. These evaporators are vital components in contemporary cooling and heat pump systems. This innovation is set to revolutionize the industry by optimizing the performance of these systems.

data.title: Walmart settles lawsuit for $100M, gains market share, stock rises. Analyst reinstates Buy rating, sets price target at $150.
data.description: Shares of Walmart Inc. (NASDAQ: WMT) are experiencing an increase in trading value, following the disclosure that the company has settled a lawsuit by paying $100 million. The positive movement in Walmart stock is attributed to BofA Securities analyst Christopher Nardone reinstating a Buy rating on the stock and setting a price target of $150. data.title: Zscaler beats Q2 expectations with earnings of $1.01/share and revenue of $815.75 million. Raises FY26 sales guidance.
data.description: Zscaler Inc. (NASDAQ: ZS) exceeded expectations in Q2 with earnings of $1.01 per share, surpassing the estimated 90 cents, and quarterly revenue of $815.75 million, above the projected $798.82 million. The innovative Zero Trust platform is designed to secure the rapid growth and scale of AI and agentic workflows. For more details, the full article can be accessed online.

data.title: InventHelp 123Invent client from Morenci, Mich. develops new hour logging & license scanning system called A B C (ALL - BOUT - COMPLIANCE).
data.description: In Pittsburgh on February 27, 2026, an inventor from Morenci, Michigan shared their motivation for creating a new logging and scanning system for hours and licenses by stating, "As a truck driver, I wanted to ensure compliance." The invention, known as A B C (ALL - BOUT - COMPLIANCE), offers a solution to monitor and maintain adherence to regulations in the industry. This innovative design provides an alternative approach to tracking and managing important data, contributing to safer and more efficient operations.

data.title: Former Biden advisor Jared Bernstein criticizes crypto, noting 'almost zero legal use cases' and calling it 'pretty good for scammers'. Bitcoin's 40% decline despite Trump's support emphasized. Regulatory concerns highlighted, with Bernstein questioning asset's value proposition. Crypto industry's influence on Congress and president noted. Regulatory shift seen as impacting prices negatively.
data.description: Jared Bernstein, former Chair of the Biden Council of Economic Advisors, criticized cryptocurrency, referring to it as an asset with minimal legal applications and a magnet for scammers. He highlighted a 40% decline in Bitcoin's value and dismissed the notion that even Donald Trump's support could salvage its situation. Bernstein argued that the industry's claim of being in its early stages no longer justifies its extreme price fluctuations, noting that regulatory challenges had initially masked its true worth until the Trump administration embraced it. According to Bernstein, the backing of Congress and the president did little to enhance crypto's reputation and actually exacerbated its negative perception in the market, leading to a swift depreciation in value. For the full article, visit Benzinga.com.
